title: חוק שירות ביטחון [נוסח משולב], תשמ"ז-1986
description: The Defense Service Law (Consolidated Version) 5746-1986 regulates compulsory military service, reserve duty, and exemptions from service in Israel. It implements the constitutional framework established by Basic Law: The Military.

provisions.title: Duty of Service
provisions.content: Section 1. Every Israeli citizen and permanent resident who has reached the age of 18 and has not been exempted or deferred is liable for defense service.

provisions.title: Exemptions
provisions.content: Section 13. The Minister of Defense may exempt from service persons who are medically unfit, persons who serve in other security forces, and other categories prescribed by law.

provisions.title: Reserve Service
provisions.content: Section 20. A person who has completed regular service is liable for reserve service until the age prescribed by law. Reserve service shall not exceed the maximum number of days prescribed per year.

provisions.title: Confidentiality
provisions.content: Section 46. Information obtained in the course of defense service regarding military matters, security matters, or personal information of service members shall be treated as confidential.
